entry_requirements_raw.A-Level: Pass with Grade D in any two (2) subjects.  Credit in Additional Mathematics at the SPM Level or its equivalent OR credit in SPM Mathematics and any one of the Science, Technology or Engineering subjects or its equivalent.
entry_requirements_raw.UEC: Pass with at least Grade B in any five (5) subjects.  Credit in Additional Mathematics at the SPM Level or its equivalent OR credit in SPM Mathematics and any one of the Science, Technology or Engineering subjects or its equivalent.
entry_requirements_raw.Diploma: Diploma in Computing fields (Level 4, MQF) : Pass with minimum CGPA of 2.50. Any Diploma in Science & Technology (Level 4,MQF) : Pass with a minimum CGPA 2.75. DKM/DVM/DLKM in Computing fields: Pass with a minimum CGPA of 2.50.
entry_requirements_raw.STPM: Arts stream: Pass with a minimum Grade of C (GP 2.00) in any (2) subjects Science stream: Pass with a minimum Grade of C (GP 2.00) in Mathematics subject and ONE (1) Science / ICT subject.  Credit in Additional Mathematics at the SPM Level or its equivalent OR credit in SPM Mathematics and any one of the Science, Technology or Engineering subjects or its equivalent.
entry_requirements_raw.Foundation: Pass with a minimum CGPA of 2.00.  Credit in Additional Mathematics at the SPM Level or its equivalent OR credit in SPM Mathematics and any one of the Science, Technology or Engineering subjects or its equivalent.

course_content.core:
Year 1 EC3105 - C Programming
EC3114 - Software Modeling and Analysis
EC3119 - Database Systems
EC3120 - Computer Architecture and Organisation
EC3121 - Introduction to Object Oriented Programming
EC3122 - Web Development
EC3123 - Operating Systems Principles
EC3127 - Understanding Computing
EC3130 - Introduction to Data Communications and Networking
EC3132 - Python Programming EC3105 - C Programming EC3114 - Software Modeling and Analysis EC3119 - Database Systems EC3120 - Computer Architecture and Organisation EC3121 - Introduction to Object Oriented Programming EC3122 - Web Development EC3123 - Operating Systems Principles EC3127 - Understanding Computing EC3130 - Introduction to Data Communications and Networking EC3132 - Python Programming Year 2 EC3234 - Data Structure and Algorithms
EC3240 - Computer Graphics
EC3243 - Object Oriented Software Development
EC3253 - Software Design and Architecture
EC3269 - Human Computer Interaction
EC3272 - Artificial Intelligence
EC3284 - Discrete Structures
EC3286 - Fuzzy Logic-Based Expert System
EC3288 - Information Assurance Security
EC3289 - Machine Learning EC3234 - Data Structure and Algorithms EC3240 - Computer Graphics EC3243 - Object Oriented Software Development EC3253 - Software Design and Architecture EC3269 - Human Computer Interaction EC3272 - Artificial Intelligence EC3284 - Discrete Structures EC3286 - Fuzzy Logic-Based Expert System EC3288 - Information Assurance Security EC3289 - Machine Learning Year 3 EC3302 - Theory of Computation
EC3306 - Software Project Management
EC3350 - Computer Vision and Image Processing
EC3355 - Big Data Analytics
EC3366 - Platform Based Development
EC3367 - Parallel and Distributed Computing
EC3368 - Artificial Intelligence in Robotics
EC3374 - Deep Learning
EC3371 - AI Project I
EC3372 - AI Project II
GP3304 - Internship EC3302 - Theory of Computation EC3306 - Software Project Management EC3350 - Computer Vision and Image Processing EC3355 - Big Data Analytics EC3366 - Platform Based Development EC3367 - Parallel and Distributed Computing EC3368 - Artificial Intelligence in Robotics EC3374 - Deep Learning EC3371 - AI Project I EC3372 - AI Project II GP3304 - Internship

A-Level.text: Pass with Grade D in any two (2) subjects.  Credit in Additional Mathematics at the SPM Level or its equivalent OR credit in SPM Mathematics and any one of the Science, Technology or Engineering subjects or its equivalent.

UEC.text: Pass with at least Grade B in any five (5) subjects.  Credit in Additional Mathematics at the SPM Level or its equivalent OR credit in SPM Mathematics and any one of the Science, Technology or Engineering subjects or its equivalent.

Diploma.text: Diploma in Computing fields (Level 4, MQF) : Pass with minimum CGPA of 2.50. Any Diploma in Science & Technology (Level 4,MQF) : Pass with a minimum CGPA 2.75. DKM/DVM/DLKM in Computing fields: Pass with a minimum CGPA of 2.50.

STPM.text: Arts stream: Pass with a minimum Grade of C (GP 2.00) in any (2) subjects Science stream: Pass with a minimum Grade of C (GP 2.00) in Mathematics subject and ONE (1) Science / ICT subject.  Credit in Additional Mathematics at the SPM Level or its equivalent OR credit in SPM Mathematics and any one of the Science, Technology or Engineering subjects or its equivalent.

Foundation.text: Pass with a minimum CGPA of 2.00.  Credit in Additional Mathematics at the SPM Level or its equivalent OR credit in SPM Mathematics and any one of the Science, Technology or Engineering subjects or its equivalent.

course_content.core: Phase l  Preparatory Briefing Briefing to prepare students for the research programme, with emphasis on Research Methodology and Statistics. Phase ll  Preliminary Research All M.Eng.Sc. students are required to undertake preliminary research to gain clarity in the respective areas of study and plan their research work. This normally includes identification of problem statement, literature review, project design and time management. Phase lll  Proposal Defence Each student must publicly present and defend his/her research proposals. The student is only allowed to continue with his/her research to Phase IV on passing of the defence of his/her proposal. Phase lV  Thesis Preparation The student proceeds to his/her data collection, data analysis and report writing. Phase V  Viva Vove Phase V  Viva Vove After completion and submission of the thesis, the student is required to attend a Viva Voce to orally defend his/her thesis.

Phase l  Pre-requisite Core Course Research Methodology and Statistics (Only for students who do not have sufficient knowledge or background on research methodology and statistics). (Only for students who do not have sufficient knowledge or background on research methodology and statistics). Phase ll  Preliminary Research This represents the first part of the Master's thesis project and forms the basis on which students build their proposal and eventually their project. Master's thesis project project. Phase lll - Proposal Defence Each student must publicly present and defend his/her research proposals. The student is only allowed to continue with his/her research to Phase IV on passing of the defence of his/her proposal. Phase lV  Thesis Preparation The student proceeds to his/her data collection, data analysis and report writing. Phase V  Viva Voce After completion and submission of the thesis, the student is required to attend a Viva Voce to orally defend his/her thesis.
